TestCase.TestCase_Title: Modify the value of a multi-valued variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a "Category0" category within the "AdminContext" context
Create a multi-valued variable "Variable0" of type "Variable" within the "Category0" category with values "Value0" and "Value1"
Create a a multi-valued variable "FileVariable0" of type "FileVariable" within the "Category0" category with values "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\system.ini"
Create a a multi-valued variable "FolderVariable0" of type "FolderVariable" within the "Category0" category with values "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\System32"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The multiple values table contains two values "Value0" and "Value1"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Change the the second value of the multiple values table to "Value2"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable has two values: "Value0" and "Value2"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FileVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The multiple values table contains two values "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\system.ini"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "C:\Windows\system.ini" in the multiple values table

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The second value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\explorer.exe"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable0" variable has two values: "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\explorer.exe"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FolderVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The multiple values table contains two values "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\System32"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "C:\Windows\System32" in the multiple values table

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The second value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\Temp"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable0" variable has two values: "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\Temp"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a variable "Variable0" of type "Variable" within the "Orchestra" category with value "Value0"
Create a variable "FileVariable0" of type "FileVariable" within the "Orchestra" category with value "C:\Windows\win.ini"
Create a variable "FolderVariable0" of type "FolderVariable" within the "Orchestra" category with value "C:\Windows"
Right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield contains "Value0"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable value is now "NewValue0"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FileVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up.The "Unique value:" textfield contains "C:\Windows\win.ini"
A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The "Unique value:" textfield has been set to "C:\Windows\explorer.exe"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable0" variable value is now "C:\Windows\explorer.exe"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FolderVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up..The "Unique value:" textfield contains "C:\Windows"
A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The "Unique value:" textfield has been set to "C:\Windows\Temp"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable0" variable variable value is now "C:\Windows\Temp"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Modify value of an inherited mono-valued variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a "Category0" category within the "AdminContext" context
Create a variable "Variable0" of type "Variable" within the "Category0" category with value "Value0"
Create a variable "FileVariable0" of type "FileVariable" within the "Category0" category with value "C:\Windows\win.ini"
Create a variable "FolderVariable0" of type "FolderVariable" within the "Category0" category with value "C:\Windows"
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield contains "Value0"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable value is now "NewValue0"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FileVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield contains "C:\Windows\win.ini"
A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The second value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\system.ini"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable0" variable value is now "C:\Windows\system.ini"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FolderVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield contains "C:\Windows"
A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The second value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\System32"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Modify value of an inherited multi-valued variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a multi-valued variable "Variable0" of type "Variable" within the "Orchestra" category with values "Value0" and "Value1"
Create a a multi-valued variable "FileVariable0" of type "FileVariable" within the "Orchestra" category with values "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\system.ini"
Create a a multi-valued variable "FolderVariable0" of type "FolderVariable" within the "Orchestra" category with values "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\System32"
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The multiple values table contains two values "Value0" and "Value1"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Change the the second value of the multiple values table to "Value2"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A new row has been added to the multiple values table

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the third row of the mulitple values table and enter the value "Value3"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable has three values: "Value0" and "Value2" and "Value3"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FileVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The multiple values table contains two values "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\system.ini"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "C:\Windows\system.ini" in the multiple values table

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The second value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\explorer.exe"
A new row has been added to the multiple values table

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the third row of the mulitple values table

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The third value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\notepad.exe"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable0" variable has three values: "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\explorer.exe" and "C:\Windows\notepad.exe"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FolderVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The multiple values table contains two values "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\System32"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "C:\Windows\System32" in the multiple values table

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The second value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\Temp"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable0" variable has two values: "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\Temp"
A new row has been added to the multiple values table

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the third row of the mulitple values table

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A file selector pops up
The file selector disappears. The third value of the multiple values table has been set to "C:\Windows\Fonts"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable0" variable has two values: "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\Temp" and "C:\Windows\Fonts"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Restore parent value of an inherited mono-valued variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a variable "Variable0" of type "Variable" within the "Orchestra" category with value "Value0"
Create a variable "FileVariable0" of type "FileVariable" within the "Orchestra" category with value "C:\Windows\win.ini"
Create a variable "FolderVariable0" of type "FolderVariable" within the "Orchestra" category with value "C:\Windows"
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit overriding variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield contains value "NewValue0"
The "Unique value:" textfield value has changed to "Value0"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable value is now "Value0"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FileVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit overriding variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield contains "C:\Windows\system.ini"
The "Unique value:" textfield value has changed to "C:\Windows\win.ini"
The "Edit overriding variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable0" variable value is now "C:\Windows\win.ini"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FolderVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit overriding variable" dialog box pops up. The "Unique value:" textfield contains "C:\Windows\System32"
The "Unique value:" textfield value has changed to "C:\Windows"
The "Edit overriding variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable0" variable value is now "C:\Windows"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Cannot modify a final inherited variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Orchestra" category and select "New" -> "Variable" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Variable0" variable has been added to the "Orchestra" category in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up.
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable value is now "Value0"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit overriding variable" dialog box disappears. The "Unique value" textfield is not available

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Restore parent value of an inherited multi-valued variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a multi-valued variable "Variable0" of type "Variable" within the "Orchestra" category with values "Value0" and "Value1"
Create a a multi-valued variable "FileVariable0" of type "FileVariable" within the "Orchestra" category with values "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\system.ini"
Create a a multi-valued variable "FolderVariable0" of type "FolderVariable" within the "Orchestra" category with values "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\System32"
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
Right click on the "Variable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit overriding variable" dialog box pops up. The multiple values table contains two values "Value0" and "NewValue1"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "NewValue1" in the multiple values table

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the multiple values table, "NewValue1" has been replaced by "Value0"
The "Edit overriding variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable has two values: "Value0" and "Value1"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FileVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit overriding variable" dialog box pops up. The multiple values table contains two values "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\explorer.exe"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "C:\Windows\explorer.exe" in the multiple values table

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the multiple values table, C:\Windows\explorer.exe" has been replaced by"C:\Windows\system.ini"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FileVariable0" variable has two values: "C:\Windows\win.ini" and "C:\Windows\explorer.exe"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the "FolderVariable0" variable and select "Edit" in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up. The multiple values table contains two values "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\Temp"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on "C:\Windows\Temp" in the multiple values table

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the multiple values table, C:\Windows\Temp" has been replaced by"C:\Windows\System32"
The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. In the variable viewer, the "FolderVariable0" variable has two values: "C:\Windows" and "C:\Windows\System32"

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Removal of multiple values from a multivalued variable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create a new variable "Variable0" in the "Orchestra" category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box is opened

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Set variable it as a "Multiple values" variable and fill it with four values : 1,2,3,4

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" is closed. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable is multivalued and has four values : 1,2,3,4
An "Edit variable" dialog box is opened

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select values "1" and "3" in the list by the means of Control key+Mouse Click

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Remove" key is still enabled
Both "1" and "3" values have been removed from the list
The "Edit variable" is closed. In the variable viewer, the "Variable0" variable is multivalued and has two values : 2 and 4
